title: Valentine's_Day
summary: This extract introduces Valentine's Day as an annual celebration observed on February 14, which began as a Christian feast day honoring Saint Valentine but has evolved into a widespread cultural and commercial celebration of romance and love across many parts of the world. The text also touches on the martyrdom stories associated with Saint Valentine, particularly his imprisonment under the Roman Empire and legendary acts of kindness.
extract: Valentine's Day, also called Saint Valentine's Day or the Feast of Saint Valentine, is celebrated annually on February 14. It originated as a Christian feast day honoring a martyr named Valentine, and through later folk traditions it has also become a significant cultural, religious and commercial celebration of romance and love in many regions of the world.

title: Saint_Valentine
summary: This article discusses Saint Valentine, a 3rd-century Roman saint who ministered to persecuted Christians and was martyred in Rome. The saint, whose feast day is celebrated on February 14 in Western Christianity, became associated with courtly love during the Middle Ages and is recognized as the patron saint of various causes, including epilepsy, beekeeping, and romantic love.
extract: Saint Valentine was a 3rd-century Roman saint, commemorated in Western Christianity on February 14 and in Eastern Orthodoxy on July 6. From the High Middle Ages, his feast day has been associated with a tradition of courtly love. He is also a patron saint of Terni, epilepsy, and beekeepers. Saint Valentine was a clergyman – either a priest or a bishop – in the Roman Empire who ministered to persecuted Christians. He was martyred and his body buried on the Via Flaminia on February 14, which has been observed as the Feast of Saint Valentine since at least the eighth century.
trending_reason: Saint Valentine is trending because February 14th marks Valentine's Day, the annual celebration of romantic love that coincides with his feast day in Western Christianity. The historical figure's legacy as a 3rd-century Roman martyr who ministered to persecuted Christians has evolved into a broader cultural symbol of love, while also maintaining religious significance as the patron saint of lovers, epilepsy, and beekeepers.

title: Chhaava
summary: Based on the extract, "Chhaava" is a 2025 Hindi historical epic film that depicts the life of Chatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the second ruler of the Maratha Empire, played by Vicky Kaushal. The film, directed by Laxman Utekar and adapted from Shivaji Sawant's Marathi novel "Chhava," was released on February 14, 2025, and has become the highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025, earning over ₹205 crore in its first four days.
extract: Chhaava is a 2025 Indian Hindi-language epic historical action film based on the life of Chatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the second ruler of the Maratha Empire, played by Vicky Kaushal. It is an adaptation of the Marathi novel Chhava by Shivaji Sawant. Directed by Laxman Utekar and produced by Dinesh Vijan under Maddock Films, the film also stars Rashmika Mandanna and Akshaye Khanna.

Diplomatic negotiations unfold as Mughal prince [[Muhammad Akbar (Mughal prince)|Mirza Akbar]] seeks Sambhaji’s assistance in rebelling against Aurangzeb. title: The_Gorge_(film)
summary: Based on the extract, this article describes "The Gorge," a 2025 science fiction horror action film directed by Scott Derrickson, which follows two elite snipers (played by Miles Teller and Anya Taylor-Joy) who are assigned to guard opposite sides of a mysterious gorge containing dangerous creatures called "The Hollow Men." The plot develops into a romantic storyline between the two snipers who begin communicating across the gorge, eventually leading to a dangerous situation when they attempt to meet in person.

Teller and Taylor-Joy portray two elite snipers who are ordered to guard a deep gorge without knowing what lies inside. It was released on Apple TV+ on February 14, 2025.

'''''The Gorge''''' is a 2025 American [[Science fiction film|science fiction]] [[Horror film|horror]] [[action film]] directed by [[Scott Derrickson]] and written by [[Zach Dean]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |date=2022-03-17 |title=Scott Derrickson to Direct Action Love Story 'The Gorge' for Skydance |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/scott-derrickson-direct-movie-the-gorge-skydance-1235113360/ |access-date=2022-03-19 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |language=en-US |archive-date=March 19, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220319021418/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/scott-derrickson-direct-movie-the-gorge-skydance-1235113360/ |url-status=live }}</ref> It stars [[Miles Teller]], [[Anya Taylor-Joy]], and [[Sigourney Weaver]]. Teller and Taylor-Joy portray two elite snipers who are ordered to guard a deep gorge without knowing what lies inside. It was released on [[Apple TV+]] on February 14, 2025.

==Plot==
<!-- Per [[WP:FILMPLOT]], plot summaries for feature film articles should be between 400 and 700 words. -->
Two elite [[Sniper|snipers]] receive identical missions: travel to an undisclosed location and guard the West and East sides of a deep gorge for one year without any contact with the outside world nor their counterpart on the opposite side. Levi Kane, a former [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marine]] and current [[Private military company|private contractor]] accepts the offer to guard the West tower. Drasa, a [[Lithuania|Lithuanian]] covert operative frequently employed by the [[Russia|Kremlin]], agrees to guard the East side.

Upon arriving, Levi relieves his predecessor, J.D., a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Royal Marines|Royal Marine]] of duty and asks for specifics about the mission. J.D. explains that in addition to the towers on the East and West, there are automated turret defenses to the North and South, a powerful signal ‘[[Radar jamming and deception|cloak]],’ and [[Anti-personnel mine|explosives on the walls]] of the gorge to keep the creatures inside contained. Their predecessors nicknamed the creatures, “The Hollow Men” which Levi surmises is a reference [[The Hollow Men|to the poem of the same name]] by [[T. S. Eliot|T.S. Eliot]] depicting the end of the world. While J.D. does not know the source of the creatures, he affirms that three battalions of soldiers (2,400 men) were sent into the gorge in the late 1940s but never returned. J.D. [[Extraction (military)|exfiltrates]] as planned but his contact murders him without explanation before he can board.

After several weeks, Drasa violates the communication protocol on her birthday and initiates conversations with Levi via written signs. Levi reciprocates and the two engage in a sharpshooting competition that results in a protracted escape attempt from the Hollow Men. After defending their towers and each other, Drasa uses her sign to tell Levi it was her “best birthday ever.” The two start communicating more frequently, sharing messages, playing games of chess, and making improvised drum sets. 

Six months into their tour, Levi [[Zip line|ziplines]] to the other side of the gorge to spend time with Drasa. Their date goes well as the two court one another by bringing flowers and making [[Rabbit pie|rabbit pie]]; Levi, an amateur poet, shares some of his work, including the title of a piece he is writing for Drasa, “She Collapsed the Night”. The next day, Levi attempts to cross back to his side of the gorge, but on his way back, the mines on the Western side of the gorge detonate as the Hollow Men climb it, causing him to fall into the gorge as the zipline cable snaps.

Drasa [[BASE jumping|parachutes in]] to rescue him, and the two discover that every plant, animal, and insect within the gorge have been [[Genetic engineering|cross-mutated]] with one another. Seeking shelter, they loc

'''''Some Sexy Songs 4 U''''' (stylized as '''''$ome $exy $ongs 4 U''''' or commonly shortened to '''''$$$4U''''') is a collaborative studio album by Canadian singer [[PartyNextDoor]] and Canadian rapper [[Drake (musician)|Drake]]. It was released on February 14, 2025, by [[OVO Sound]], Santa Anna, and [[Republic Records]]. The album features guest appearances from Pim, [[Chino Pacas]], and [[Yebba]]. Production was handled by PartyNextDoor and Drake's frequent collaborators [[Noel Cadastre]], [[Gordo (DJ)|Gordo]], and [[Majid Jordan|Jordan Ullman]], among others.

Originally set for a fall 2024 release, ''Some Sexy Songs 4 U'' was delayed several times and serves as a follow-up to their respective studio albums ''[[PartyNextDoor 4]]'' (2024) and ''[[For All the Dogs]]'' (2023). The album marks Drake's third collaborative project, after ''[[What a Time to Be Alive]]'' (2015) and ''[[Her Loss]]'' (2022), and PartyNextDoor's first. The album was released to mixed to negative reviews amidst the backdrop of Drake's ongoing legal dispute with [[Universal Music Group]] (UMG) and was his first full-length release following [[Drake–Kendrick Lamar feud|his feud]] with [[Kendrick Lamar]].

==Background==
The album follows the pair's numerous collaborations since PartyNextDoor signed to Drake's [[OVO Sound]] record label in 2013; the first of these was Drake's guest appearance on "Over Here" from PartyNextDoor's [[PartyNextDoor (mixtape)|eponymous mixtape]] (2013).<ref>{{cite web|last=Nadeska|first=Alexis|url=http://rapfix.mtv.com/2013/07/01/drakes-ovo-signee-partynextdoor-drops-self-titled-debut/ |title=Drake's OVO Signee PartyNextDoor Drops Self-Titled Debut|publisher=[[MTV]]|date=July 1, 2013|access-date=August 5, 2024|archive-date=July 4, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150704075532/http://rapfix.mtv.com/2013/07/01/drakes-ovo-signee-partynextdoor-drops-self-titled-debut/ |url-status=dead}}</ref> Alongside their collaborations, they have contributed to each other's individual songs as a writer or producer.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/lists/partynextdoor-songs-he-wrote-produced-beyonce-jay-z-christina-aguilera-usher/|title=7 Songs You Didn't Know PartyNextDoor Wrote & Produced|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=March 11, 2024|access-date=August 5, 2024|first=Heran|last=Mamo|archive-date=March 11, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240311171854/https://www.billboard.com/lists/partynextdoor-songs-he-wrote-produced-beyonce-jay-z-christina-aguilera-usher/|url-status=live}}</ref>

PartyNextDoor supported the release of his album ''[[PartyNextDoor 4]]'' (2024) through a twenty-four-stop Canada and U.S. live tour.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.vibe.com/news/events/partynextdoor-sorry-im-outside-tour-dates-1234874307/|title=PartyNextDoor Announces The Sorry I'm Outside Tour|magazine=[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]|date=April 30, 2024|access-date=August 5, 2024|first=Demica|last=Inman|archive-date=May 9, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240509205832/https://www.vibe.com/news/events/partynextdoor-sorry-im-outside-tour-dates-1234874307/|url-status=live}}</ref> On August 2, 2024, at the tour's stop at the [[Budweiser Stage]] in [[Toronto]]—the artists' hometown—Drake performed as a surprise guest, with his set foregoing any of the hip-hop

title: Emil_Bove
summary: Based on the extract, Emil Bove is an American attorney who was appointed as the acting U.S. Deputy Attorney General under Donald Trump in 2025. Prior to this role, he served as an assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York and was a member of Trump's legal defense team, with notable experience prosecuting high-profile cases including those against Nicolás Maduro and Cesar Sayoc.

'''Emil Joseph Bove III''' ({{IPAc-en|b|o:|'|v|ei}}; born {{birth based on age as of date | 43 | 2025 | 02 | 06 | noage = 1}}) is an American attorney serving as the acting [[United States Deputy Attorney General|U.S. deputy attorney general]]. He is a former [[assistant United States Attorney]] and was a member of [[Donald Trump]]'s legal defense team.<ref name="reuters" />

==Early life and education==
Bove is from [[Seneca Falls, New York]]. His father, Emil Bove Jr., is a retired assistant [[New York attorney general]].<ref name=wedding/>

Bove graduated from [[Mynderse Academy]] as his class [[salutatorian]].<ref name=legalteam/><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.fingerlakes1.com/2024/11/15/trump-attorney-seneca-falls-native-emil-bove-tapped-for-top-doj-role/|title=Trump attorney, Seneca Falls native Emil Bove tapped for top DOJ role|date=November 15, 2024|website=www.fingerlakes1.com|access-date=November 15, 2024}}</ref> He attended the [[University at Albany, SUNY]], where he was [[captain (sports)|captain]] of the [[Albany Great Danes men's lacrosse]] team. Bove was named the [[America East Conference]] Male Scholar Athlete Award for 2002–2003.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.albany.edu/main/features/2003/08-03/bove/bove.htm|title=UAlbany's Emil Bove, '03, wins America East top award|website=www.albany.edu|access-date=November 15, 2024}}</ref> He graduated in 2003 with a bachelor's degree in public policy and economics ''[[summa cum laude]]''.<ref name=legalteam>{{Cite web|url=https://www.fingerlakesdailynews.com/local/ontario-seneca-wayne/former-seneca-falls-man-leading-president-trumps-legal-team|title=Former Seneca Falls Man Leading President Trump's Legal Team|date=April 29, 2024|work=Finger Lakes Daily News|access-date=November 15, 2024}}</ref><ref name=fltimes/> Bove earned his [[Juris Doctor]] from the [[Georgetown University School of Law]] in 2008.<ref name=legalteam/>

==Legal career==
After graduating from law school, Bove [[law clerk|clerked]] for [[Richard J. Sullivan]], then of the [[United States District Court for the Southern District of New York]] in 2008 and 2009<ref name="wedding" /> and for [[Richard C. Wesley]] of the [[United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit]] in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.albany.edu/ualbanymagazine/fall10_features_like_family.shtml|title=UAlbany Magazine - Fall 2010 - University at Albany - SUNY|website=www.albany.edu}}</ref>

Bove worked as an associate at [[Sullivan & Cromwell]] before becoming an [[assistant US Attorney]] in the [[Southern District of New York]], where he served as the co-chief of the national security and international narcotics unit.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2021-05-10 |title=Emil Bove {{!}} Albany Law School |url=https://www.albanylaw.edu/emil-bove |access-date=2025-01-26 |website=www.albanylaw.edu |language=en}}</ref><ref name=univision/> While there, he led the unit's prosecutions of [[Nicolás Maduro]],<ref>{{Citeweb|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2025/02/07/us/politics/emil-bove-justice-fbi-trump-bondi.html|title=At Justice Dept., Trump’s Former Criminal Defender Emerges as His Enforcer|last1=Thrush|first1=Glenn|last2=Goldman|first2=Adam|last3=Bromwich|first3=Jonah E.|last4=Haberman|first4=Maggie|publisher=[[The New York Times]]|quote=Mr. Bove was a player in high-profile cases, including the successful prosecution of Caesar Sayoc, a Florida man charged with sending pipe bombs to prominent Democrats and Trump critics. He also oversaw the indictment of President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela on drug-trafficking charges.|date=February 7, 2025|accessdate=February 8, 2025}}</ref> [[Cesar Sayoc]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://apnews.com/general-news-cb6cbc5b1979dd977a5dc15290e4f10c|title='We lied': NY prosecutors face heat in botched sanction case|date=February 23, 2021|agency=[[Associated Press]]|access-date=November 15, 2024}}</ref> [[Tony Hernández]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.dw.com/en/honduran-presidents-brother-convicted-in-us-court-of-drug-trafficking/a-

title: Eric_Adams
summary: Based on this extract and my knowledge, Eric Adams is the current Mayor of New York City (110th) who took office in 2022, following a career as an NYPD police captain and service as a New York State Senator and Brooklyn Borough President. His political affiliation has shifted over time, having been a Democrat for most of his career but with a period as a Republican from 1995 to 2002.
extract: Eric Leroy Adams is an American politician and former police officer who has served as the 110th mayor of New York City since 2022. Adams was an officer in the New York City Transit Police and then the New York City Police Department (NYPD) for more than 20 years, retiring at the rank of captain. He served in the New York State Senate from 2006 to 2013, representing the 20th district in Brooklyn. In 2013, Adams was elected Brooklyn Borough President, the first Black American to hold the position, and re-elected in 2017.

title: Mikey_Madison
summary: This article is about American actress Mikey Madison, born in 1999, who gained initial recognition for her role in FX's "Better Things" and later achieved prominence with her acclaimed performance in "Anora" (2024). The article details her career progression from early acting work to her breakout role, which earned her several prestigious award nominations including a BAFTA win and an Academy Award nomination.
extract: Mikaela "Mikey" Madison Rosberg is an American actress. She began her career acting in short films and received recognition playing Max Fox in the FX comedy series Better Things (2016–2022). She then played Susan Atkins in Quentin Tarantino's period film Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019) and Amber Freeman in the horror film Scream (2022).

'''Mikaela '''"'''Mikey'''"''' Madison Rosberg''' (born March 25, 1999)<ref>{{cite web|title=UPI Almanac for Monday, March 25, 2024|date=March 25, 2024|website=United Press International|url=https://www.upi.com/amp/Top_News/2024/03/25/UPI-Almanac-for-Monday-March-25-2024/9631711330192/|accessdate=February 2, 2025}}</ref> is an American actress. She began her career acting in short films and received recognition playing Max Fox in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] comedy series ''[[Better Things (TV series)|Better Things]]'' (2016–2022). She then played [[Susan Atkins]] in [[Quentin Tarantino]]'s period film ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]'' (2019) and [[List of Scream (film series) characters#Amber Freeman|Amber Freeman]] in the horror film ''[[Scream (2022 film)|Scream]]'' (2022). 

Madison rose to prominence with her acclaimed performance as the title character in the romantic comedy-drama film ''[[Anora]]'' (2024), which earned her many accolades, including the [[BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Leading Role|BAFTA Award for Best Actress]] and Best Actress nominations from the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actress in a Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy|Golden Globes]], [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role|Screen Actors Guild]] and the [[Academy Award for Best Actress|Academy Awards]].

==Early and personal life==
Mikaela Madison Rosberg was born in [[Los Angeles]] and grew up in the [[San Fernando Valley]].<ref name=":2">{{cite news |last=Yuan |first=Jada |date=October 18, 2024 |title=Mikey Madison got 'almost too comfortable' in strip clubs for 'Anora' |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/movies/interactive/2024/mikey-madison-anora-oscar-buzz/ |url-status=usurped |archive-url=https://archive.ph/f8RVb |archive-date=2024-10-18 |access-date=October 22, 2024 |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]}}</ref> Both of her parents are psychologists and she has two brothers, one of whom is her twin, and two sisters.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kelsey |first=Colleen |date=June 5, 2017 |title=Mikey Madison |url=https://www.interviewmagazine.com/film/mikey-madison |access-date=October 21, 2024 |website=[[Interview (magazine)|Interview Magazine]] |language=en-US |archive-date=August 5, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200805050510/https://www.interviewmagazine.com/film/mikey-madison |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.instyle.com/tv-shows/why-you-should-binge-watch-better-things-over-holiday-weekend-according-mikey-madison|title=Why you should binge watch Better Things over the Long Weekend, according to Mikey Madison|first=Christina|last=Shanahan|date=November 24, 2016|access-date=May 4, 2017|website=[[InStyle]]|archive-date=May 2, She is [[Jews|Jewish]].<ref>https://www.allure.com/video/watch/mikey-madison-breaks-down-her-anora-beauty-transformation, or https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fQ4EBMD5pLg</ref><ref name=":2" /><ref>{{Cite news |first=Nate |last=Bloom |authorlink=Nate Bloom |title=Mikey Madison, Pamela Adlon and Mark Eydelstein |newspaper=jewishtampa.com |date=June 19, 2024 |url=https://www.jewishtampa.com/jews-in-the-news/mikey-madison-pamela-adlon-and-mark-eydelstein |via= reveal that three of her four grandparents were Jewish. Her maternal grandmother was not Jewish (it's possible that she "converted-in") |access-date=December 21, 2024 |url-status=live }}</ref>

Madison initially trained as a competitive [[Equestrianism|horseback rider]] before switching to acting at age 14. She was homeschooled after the seventh grade.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":4">{{Cite web |date=November 1, 2024 |title=Get to Know Mikey Madison, the Star of 'Anora' |url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a62775446/who-is-mikey-madison/ |access-date=November 7, 2024 |website=ELLE |language=en-US}}</ref> As of October 2024, Madison lives in Los Angeles.<ref name=":3" />

title: 2019_Pulwama_attack
summary: The article describes the 2019 Pulwama attack, a terrorist incident that occurred on February 14, 2019, in Jammu and Kashmir, India, where a suicide bomber targeted a convoy of Indian security personnel, killing 40 Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) members. The Pakistan-based terrorist group Jaish-e-Mohammed claimed responsibility for the attack, which significantly strained India-Pakistan relations and led to military standoffs between the two nations.
extract: The 2019 Pulwama attack occurred on 14 February 2019, when a convoy of vehicles carrying Indian security personnel on the Jammu–Srinagar National Highway was attacked by a vehicle-borne suicide bomber at Lethapora in the Pulwama district of the erstwhile state of Jammu and Kashmir. The attack killed 40 Indian Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel as well as the perpetrator—Adil Ahmad Dar—who was a local Kashmiri youth from the Pulwama district. The responsibility for the attack was claimed by the Pakistan-based Islamist terrorist group, Jaish-e-Mohammed. India blamed neighbouring Pakistan for the attack, while the latter condemned the attack and denied having any connections to it. The attack dealt a severe blow to India–Pakistan relations, consequently resulting in the 2019 India–Pakistan military standoff. Subsequently, Indian investigations identified 19 accused. By August 2021, the main accused along with six others had been killed, and seven had been arrested.
